intro: Crocodilodes gorteroides, commonly known as the Gorter's crocodile plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, adapting to arid and semi-arid conditions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a popular plant among succulent enthusiasts and botanists.
